Regulators also approved a “mix and match” program that allows people who’ve received one brand’s vaccine to get another as a booster.</span>
</li>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding:12px;background-color:#E8E8E8"><strong style="color:#000;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;">Markets Sponsored by Fidelity Investments<br></strong>In the latest episode of Fresh Invest, we tackle physical real estate as a wealth builder: what kind of asset it is relative to equities and the broader economy—and how to get involved if you feel it’s right for you. <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/509483501;309552730;e" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1C7FF2;text-decoration:none;color:#333;">Listen now</a>.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/20/do-you-know-who-my-dad-is?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Do You Know Who My Dad Is?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/20/do-you-know-who-my-dad-is?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Amherst College campus" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/a22b5c960026f338d4b6c9c9f9ad82070344f548-799x533.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Amherst College</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No, and Amherst College doesn’t care. The selective school in Western MA announced that its admissions office will no longer <a href="https://amherststudent.com/article/college-announces-end-of-legacy-admissions/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">play favorites</a> when considering the applications of children of alumni. In other words, preference for second-generation Mammoths—which account for about 11% of each class—is going extinct.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Other elite colleges that don’t factor in applicants’ family trees include Caltech, MIT, and any school that starts with “University of California.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But that’s far from the norm: </strong>43% of private, nonprofit universities and 14% of public ones consider legacy status in their admissions decisions, according to a 2019 study conducted by a national admissions group. 73% of the <em>most</em> selective schools—ones with a 25%-or-less admission rate like Amherst—do the same.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Pressure to change that is building</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This fall, students launched #LeaveYourLegacy campaigns at Harvard and Brown, asking alumni to <a href="https://www.thecrimson.com/article/2021/9/30/edmobilizer-legacy-admissions/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">boycott donations</a> until the schools stop asking, “Who do you know here?” And just last week, Colorado passed a bill <a href="https://www.insidehighered.com/admissions/article/2021/06/01/colorado-bars-public-colleges-using-legacy-admissions?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banning preference</a> for applicants with alumni relatives at all public schools in the state.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Critics of legacy admissions argue the practice disproportionately favors white, wealthy applicants and takes admissions spots away from those who are less privileged, but academically more deserving.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>At Johns Hopkins University, which started phasing out legacy preference in 2014 and completely nixed it in 2019, the proportion of accepted students whose parents were alumni more than halved from 2013 to this year, while its share of first-generation students more than doubled.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In a civil case that accused Harvard of discriminating against Asian American applicants in 2018, an economist hired by the plaintiffs said that Harvard accepted legacy applicants at a rate 5x higher than it did nonlegacy applicants. Over one-third of Harvard’s Class of 2022 had alumni parents.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Proponents of legacy admissions keep their reasoning simple: It’s smart financially, encouraging alumni donations and continued engagement with the school.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Amherst’s change will go into effect for the 2022–2023 school year.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
M&A
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/20/paypal-in-early-stage-talks-to-acquire-pinterest?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
PayPal Is Pinterested
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">PayPal is in desperate need of wall art recs. The payment giant is in talks to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-20/paypal-said-to-explore-purchase-of-social-media-firm-pinterest?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acquire</a> the wedding-and-soup inspo site Pinterest, according to multiple reports. The deal would likely value Pinterest at $45 billion, and shares jumped roughly 13% yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Why would it make sense?</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">PayPal</strong></span><span> is on a quest to become an all-in-one “super app” like China’s Alipay, so it’s looking to tack on more services, like product discovery, to its current menu. Plus, it’s got money to play with. Thanks to all those nap dress orders during the pandemic, PayPal’s stock has more than doubled since January 2020.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">For Pinterest, </strong></span><span>this could be a huge boost for its push into commerce. The company has moved aggressively to get more people to shop on its site with initiatives like a </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2021/10/20/pinterest-s-revamped-shopping-features-focus-on-discovery?utm_campaign=rtb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$20 million investment</a></span><span> into its “Creator Rewards” program. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>If a deal is completed—and it, just like our Friday plans, could fall apart at any time—it would be one of the biggest consumer internet takeovers in years, topping Salesforce’s $27.7 billion purchase of Slack last winter.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/20/global-fossil-fuel-production-dangerously-out-of-sync-with-paris-climate-agreement-report-says?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The World to Fossil Fuels: I Just Can't Quit You
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/20/global-fossil-fuel-production-dangerously-out-of-sync-with-paris-climate-agreement-report-says?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A grill with the exterior of the Earth " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f30d4c9d6d59525d3150b85bc0cb8de6627cb86e-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba </em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With just over a week until one of the most pivotal climate change summits in history begins, governments are still clinging to fossil fuels like a childhood teddy bear.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A new UN-backed climate report found that countries <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-58971131?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plan to extract</a> more than double the amount of fossil fuels in 2030 required to limit warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius, calling it “dangerously out of sync” with the targets set out by the Paris Agreement.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>This year’s energy crunch has highlighted <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-20/coal-power-continues-to-dominate-global-energy-mix?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just how dependent</a> the world remains on fossil fuels for power, specifically coal—the largest source of greenhouse gases in the electricity sector.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Coal prices in China have soared to </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/china-coal-hits-record-high-amid-tight-supplies-2021-10-19/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record highs</a></span><span> in recent weeks as the country grapples with an energy shortfall.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In the US, we’ll burn </span><span><a href="https://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2021/10/coal-bucks-15-year-decline-in-us-with-22-increase-as-natural-gas-prices-rise/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">22% more coal</a></span><span> in 2021 than we did last year, marking the first YoY uptick in US coal generation since 2014, according to the Energy Information Administration.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>“The research is clear: global coal, oil, and gas production must start declining immediately and steeply” in order to keep warming to manageable levels, said Ploy Achakulwisut, a lead author of the report.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Any Nigels reading this? You might be the last of your kind. There were at <em>most</em> <a href="https://twitter.com/hwallop/status/1450040818446839810?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two Nigels</a> born in 2020 in England and Wales, according to a new report from the Office for National Statistics. As names like Nigel (and Carol) fade away, an army of Olivias and Olivers is rising: They were the <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-58957676?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">top names</a> given for the fifth year running.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“We refuse to become the vaccination police for any government.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Arnie Wensinger, In-N-Out Burger’s chief legal and business officer, <a href="https://www.foxnews.com/politics/san-francisco-shuts-down-in-n-out-for-not-enforcing-jab-mandate-we-refuse-to-become-the-vaccination-police?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pushed back</a> after San Francisco’s department of health temporarily shut down the only In-N-Out location in the city for refusing to check diners’ vaccination status. Restaurants in SF, NYC, and other cities are required to ensure their customers are vaccinated in order to eat indoors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Inside <em>Wheel of Time, </em>Amazon’s huge gamble on the next <em>Game of Thrones</em>. (<a href="https://www.gq.com/story/inside-amazons-wheel-of-time?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">GQ</a>)</p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/10/19/22735612/facebook-change-company-name-metaverse?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">report</a> from The Verge revealed that Facebook will rebrand itself, everyone on the internet speculated about what the new name would be, ranging from “A Mark Zuckerberg Production” to the not-Justin Timberlake-approved “The Facebook.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>One contender is “</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-20/meta-horizon-facebook-renaming-report-sparks-speculation?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Meta</a></span><span>,” since, well, it’s short for metaverse and meta.com redirects to a website for a medical research tool developed under the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, which the Facebo​​ok CEO co-founded.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here are the current odds on Facebook’s new name, via <a href="https://mobile.sportsbetting.ag/sports/futures-and-props/entertainment?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">SportsBetting.AG</a>:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Virtuel: </strong>4-1<strong style="color:#000"><br>Connect: </strong>5-1<strong style="color:#000"><br>Horizon: </strong>5-1<strong style="color:#000"><br>Ecoverse: </strong>7-1<strong style="color:#000"><br>Metabook: </strong>8-1<strong style="color:#000"><br>Immerse: </strong>8-1<strong style="color:#000"><br>Omniverse: </strong>10-1<strong style="color:#000"><br>…<br>MetaBeast: </strong>80-1<strong style="color:#000"><br>Zuckers: </strong>100-1</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Where are you putting your money? <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And of course we <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@morningbrew/video/7021250844280524037?sender_device=pc&sender_web_id=6897986481718085126&is_from_webapp=v1&is_copy_url=0" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made a TikTok</a> about it.—<em>NF</em></p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nEDUCATION\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/20/do-you-know-who-my-dad-is?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nDo You Know Who My Dad Is?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/20/do-you-know-who-my-dad-is?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Amherst College campus\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/a22b5c960026f338d4b6c9c9f9ad82070344f548-799x533.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eAmherst College\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNo, and Amherst College doesn’t care. The selective school in Western MA announced that its admissions office will no longer \u003ca href=\"https://amherststudent.com/article/college-announces-end-of-legacy-admissions/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplay favorites\u003c/a\u003e when considering the applications of children of alumni. In other words, preference for second-generation Mammoths—which account for about 11% of each class—is going extinct.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOther elite colleges that don’t factor in applicants’ family trees include Caltech, MIT, and any school that starts with “University of California.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut that’s far from the norm: \u003c/strong\u003e43% of private, nonprofit universities and 14% of public ones consider legacy status in their admissions decisions, according to a 2019 study conducted by a national admissions group. 73% of the \u003cem\u003emost\u003c/em\u003e selective schools—ones with a 25%-or-less admission rate like Amherst—do the same.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003ePressure to change that is building\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis fall, students launched #LeaveYourLegacy campaigns at Harvard and Brown, asking alumni to \u003ca href=\"https://www.thecrimson.com/article/2021/9/30/edmobilizer-legacy-admissions/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eboycott donations\u003c/a\u003e until the schools stop asking, “Who do you know here?” And just last week, Colorado passed a bill \u003ca href=\"https://www.insidehighered.com/admissions/article/2021/06/01/colorado-bars-public-colleges-using-legacy-admissions?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebanning preference\u003c/a\u003e for applicants with alumni relatives at all public schools in the state.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCritics of legacy admissions argue the practice disproportionately favors white, wealthy applicants and takes admissions spots away from those who are less privileged, but academically more deserving.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAt Johns Hopkins University, which started phasing out legacy preference in 2014 and completely nixed it in 2019, the proportion of accepted students whose parents were alumni more than halved from 2013 to this year, while its share of first-generation students more than doubled.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn a civil case that accused Harvard of discriminating against Asian American applicants in 2018, an economist hired by the plaintiffs said that Harvard accepted legacy applicants at a rate 5x higher than it did nonlegacy applicants. Over one-third of Harvard’s Class of 2022 had alumni parents.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eProponents of legacy admissions keep their reasoning simple: It’s smart financially, encouraging alumni donations and continued engagement with the school.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eAmherst’s change will go into effect for the 2022–2023 school year.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePayPal is in desperate need of wall art recs. The payment giant is in talks to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-20/paypal-said-to-explore-purchase-of-social-media-firm-pinterest?srnd=premium\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eacquire\u003c/a\u003e the wedding-and-soup inspo site Pinterest, according to multiple reports. The deal would likely value Pinterest at $45 billion, and shares jumped roughly 13% yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhy would it make sense?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePayPal\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e is on a quest to become an all-in-one “super app” like China’s Alipay, so it’s looking to tack on more services, like product discovery, to its current menu. Plus, it’s got money to play with. Thanks to all those nap dress orders during the pandemic, PayPal’s stock has more than doubled since January 2020.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor Pinterest, \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethis could be a huge boost for its push into commerce. The company has moved aggressively to get more people to shop on its site with initiatives like a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2021/10/20/pinterest-s-revamped-shopping-features-focus-on-discovery?utm_campaign=rtb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$20 million investment\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e into its “Creator Rewards” program. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIf a deal is completed—and it, just like our Friday plans, could fall apart at any time—it would be one of the biggest consumer internet takeovers in years, topping Salesforce’s target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplan to extract\u003c/a\u003e more than double the amount of fossil fuels in 2030 required to limit warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius, calling it “dangerously out of sync” with the targets set out by the Paris Agreement.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThis year’s energy crunch has highlighted \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-20/coal-power-continues-to-dominate-global-energy-mix?srnd=premium\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejust how dependent\u003c/a\u003e the world remains on fossil fuels for power, specifically coal—the largest source of greenhouse gases in the electricity sector.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCoal prices in China have soared to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2021/10/coal-bucks-15-year-decline-in-us-with-22-increase-as-natural-gas-prices-rise/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e22% more coal\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in 2021 than we did last
